**ASP Rules for Problem 1 (N-Queens Puzzle):**  
```asp
% Define the constants for rows and columns
index_of_row(1; 2; 3; 4; 5; 6; 7; 8).
index_of_column(1; 2; 3; 4; 5; 6; 7; 8).

% Assign a queen to a unique row and column
assign(Ir, Ic) :- index_of_row(Ir), index_of_column(Ic).

% Ensure no two queens share the same row
{assign(Ir, Ic): index_of_column(Ic)} = 1 :- index_of_row(Ir).

% Ensure no two queens share the same column
{assign(Ir, Ic): index_of_row(Ir)} = 1 :- index_of_column(Ic).

% Ensure no two queens share the same diagonal (anti-diagonal)
:- assign(Ir1, Ic1), assign(Ir2, Ic2), Ir1 - Ic1 = Ir2 - Ic2.
:- assign(Ir1, Ic1), assign(Ir2, Ic2), Ir1 + Ic1 = Ir2 + Ic2.
```

**ASP Rules for Problem 2 (Employee-Price-Wood Type Matching):**  
```asp
% Define the constants for each category
employee("Bonita"; "Yvette"; "Tabitha").
price(225; 275; 325).
wood_type("ash"; "poplar"; "sandalwood").

% Each employee is matched with exactly one price and one wood type
{match(E, P, W): price(P), wood_type(W)} = 1 :- employee(E).
```

**ASP Rules for Problem 1 (N-Queens Puzzle):**  
```asp
% Define the constants for rows and columns
index_of_row(1; 2; 3; 4; 5; 6; 7; 8).
index_of_column(1; 2; 3; 4; 5; 6; 7; 8).

% Place exactly one queen in each row and column
{assign(Ir, Ic)} = 1 :- index_of_row(Ir).
{assign(Ir, Ic)} = 1 :- index_of_column(Ic).

% Ensure no two queens share the same diagonal
:- assign(Ir1, Ic1), assign(Ir2, Ic2), Ir1 - Ic1 = Ir2 - Ic2.
:- assign(Ir1, Ic1), assign(Ir2, Ic2), Ir1 + Ic1 = Ir2 + Ic2.
```

price(225; 275; 325).
wood_type("ash"; "poplar"; "sandalwood").

% Each employee matches exactly one price and one wood type
{match(E, P, W)} = 1 :- employee(E), price(P), wood_type(W).
```

is_lpidopteran(X) :- is_insect(X).

is_eight_legged("Sally").
```

---

### **ASP Rules**
```asp
% Define the constants in each category.
employee("Bonita"; "Yvette"; "Tabitha").

distinct_rows(Ir1, Ir2)

same_diagonal(Ir1, Ic1, Ir2, Ic2)  
```
